import plotly.express as px
import pandas as pd
from datetime import datetime, timedelta

# Define tasks for the maintenance phase
tasks = [
    {"Task": "Monitoring and Bug Fixes", "Start": datetime(2024, 11, 15), "End": datetime(2024, 12, 15)},
    {"Task": "System Updates and Patching", "Start": datetime(2024, 11, 22), "End": datetime(2024, 12, 01)},
    {"Task": "Performance Optimization", "Start": datetime(2024, 12, 02), "End": datetime(2024, 12, 16)},
    {"Task": "User Support", "Start": datetime(2024, 11, 15), "End": datetime(2025, 01, 01)},
    {"Task": "Documentation Updates", "Start": datetime(2024, 12, 16), "End": datetime(2024, 12, 21)},
    {"Task": "Preventative Maintenance", "Start": datetime(2024, 12, 21), "End": datetime(2025, 01, 05)},
]

# Convert tasks into a DataFrame
df = pd.DataFrame(tasks)

# Create the Gantt chart using Plotly
fig = px.timeline(
    df,
    x_start="Start",
    x_end="End",
    y="Task",
    title="Maintenance Phase Gantt Chart for Non-Profit Ride-Sharing System",
    labels={"Task": "Maintenance Tasks"},
)

# Update layout for better readability
fig.update_yaxes(categoryorder="total ascending")
fig.update_layout(
    xaxis_title="Timeline",
    yaxis_title="Tasks",
    title_x=0.5,
    template="plotly_white"
)

# Show the chart
fig.show()
